text: Tax attorney just reminded me that the federal biz deduction is limited for passenger cars but not for SUVs. For that reason, based on advice from their CPAs, many dentists are driving around in SUVs. Depressing.
author: erik_engquist

text: Fiction: Specialized high schools set their cutoff scores. Fact: Exam takers’ choices determine the cutoff score. Top scorers get their top-choice school until it’s full. Stuy ends up with a higher cutoff score because many high scorers list it first.
author: erik_engquist

text: Incidentally, our freelancer Catherine Curan called and emailed your office for a comment for her story on Industry City but never heard back.
author: erik_engquist

text: Thanks, BoroParkEye! I happen to agree with Yaffed, by the way. I am also a repeat customer of B&H Photo...
author: erik_engquist

text: Graffiti vandal. Not artist. A good use of NYPD resources, in my view, regardless of what he was writing.
author: erik_engquist

text: “The point is to prepare the kid for the road, instead of preparing the road for the kid.” Great line, great article: https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/16/style/snowplow-parenting-scandal.html?smid=nytcore-ios-share … via @NYTimes
author: erik_engquist

text: This is a big deal for climate policy yet very under the radar. We need more folks banging the drums about this. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/20/opinion/climate-building-codes.html?smid=nytcore-ios-share … via @NYTOpinion
author: erik_engquist

text: If @amazon's HQ2 project were still pending in NYC, would it have fired this warehouse worker? I'm guessing not. That's why I think @RWDSU had buyer's remorse about killing the project: It cost the union leverage
author: erik_engquist

text: Classic windshield policymaking: @NYGovCuomo is driven around, so he notices dirty car-tunnel walls and demands @MTA clean them. If he'd been a straphanger, he'd have put resources into subways (far more important). https://www.wsj.com/articles/we-need-a-plan-asapcuomo-sends-mta-scrambling-to-clean-tunnels-11552881660 … @WSJ @RidersNY @transalt @streetsblog
author: erik_engquist

text: This was like shooting fish in a barrel. Not just for police, but also for the headline writer: Trump-supporting vandal caught after NYPD builds a wall in Brooklyn Heights station | am New York
author: erik_engquist

text: Just have your scheduler call or email to arrange an editorial board meeting. https://www.crainsnewyork.com/staff/all-staff-page …
author: erik_engquist

text: I didn't interpret the letter as a negotiating tactic. Its message was clear: Start the clock now and you'll kill the rezoning. Other council members will surely adopt this tactic, effectively stretching Ulurp from 7 months to "as long as the local member wants."
author: erik_engquist

text: Some people will never understand why newspapers publish op-eds even if they disagree with the writer's argument. Apparently you are one of them. I won't try to talk you out of your position, but know that we have published several op-eds and letters supporting yeshiva reform.
author: erik_engquist

text: An environmentalist emailed me that he loved this line in our climate-change editorial: "Climate deniers have receded, but in their place have stepped self-proclaimed realists who love to say what cannot be done." https://www.crainsnewyork.com/editorials/bold-words-climate-change-call-brave-action … via @CrainsNewYork
author: erik_engquist

text: March Madness bound! Bulldogs cut Harvard to pieces in Ivy tourney championship game
author: erik_engquist
